text: Confetti are small pieces of paper or other material that is thrown into the air at a celebration such as party or a wedding.Definition of confetti from Oxford Dictionaries Online, web: . Confetti comes in a variety of colors and shapes. In some places including Europe, the use of confetti is banned due to health problems of people, animals or the earth, or due to the work needed to clean up the confetti afterward. Foil and plastic confetti are not biodegradable. Some cans are illegal due to banned items in them. The first known use of confetti was in 1815, as the Italian word "confetto" meaning "sweetmeat". == References == Category:Parties
title: Confetti
